title: Guinness Receives Platinum Award
text:
19:15 CET Guinness Receives Platinum Award By Daily Guide 
Charles Tettey, Brewing Manager, GGBL receiving the award from Okofo Sobin Kan. With him is Daniel Sarkodie, Union Chairman of Kaasi Site 
Guinness Ghana Breweries Limited (GGBL), Ghana's total beverage company, was honoured with the Platinum award at the 12 th Ashanti Business Excellence Awards held at the Golden Tulip Hotel, Kumasi in the Ashanti region. 
GGBL was honoured in recognition of its outstanding contribution to the economic development of the Ashanti Region with regards to manufacturing, as well as its contribution to the development of the region in totality since it commenced operations in the 1960s. 
The Ashanti Business Excellence Awards was organized under the auspices of Manhyia Palace, and the 12th edition was dedicated to the 80 th Anniversary of the restoration of the Ashanti Confederacy. 
Recently, GGBL invested about GHÂ¢200 million to expand its production capacity at Kaasi. 
It would use local raw materials such as cassava and sorghum to produce innovative brands like Ruut Extra Beer, Ghana first cassava beer and Top Malt, made from 70 percent sorghum sourced locally in Ghana. 
Commenting on the awards, Preba Greenstreet, Corporate Relations Director said, 'Our legacy in the Ashanti region is strong and we are committed to further strengthen this with our investments and the value we create through our operations. 
'We applaud organizers of this event for recognizing the effort of industry in the development of the region.'
